Package alydiaade.flooringmastery.view

Class FlooringMasteryView

  • java.lang.Object
    • alydiaade.flooringmastery.view.FlooringMasteryView
  • public class FlooringMasteryView
extends Object
    This is the class that interacts with the user, by displaying/printing all the relevant messages. It utilises the user IO console methods to effectively interact with the user.
    Author:
    lydiaadejumo

      • displayMenu

        public int displayMenu()
        This method displays the menu to the user, which includes all the possible options available to the user of which they will input their choice.
        Returns:
        - the users choice will be returned to the controller.

      • displayOptionBanner

        public void displayOptionBanner​(String message)
        This will display the respective banner for each option selected.
        Parameters:
        message - - the message to be displayed on the previous user choice.

      • getAllOrderDates

        public LocalDate getAllOrderDates()
        This method is utilised to gauge which order/delivery date the user would like to see.
        Returns:
        - the order date will be returned to the controller.

      • displayOrders

        public void displayOrders​(LocalDate orderDate,
                          List<Order> allOrders)
        This method is used to display all the orders on a particular date that has been previously inputted by the user.
        Parameters:
        orderDate - - the order/delivery date given the previously
        allOrders - - all the orders retrieved for the orderDate

      • displayEachOrder

        public void displayEachOrder​(Order eachOrder)
        This method is used to display the information for orders, which includes the name, dates (delivery, order creation), state name, tax rates, costs and if the order is currently active.
        Parameters:
        eachOrder - - the order that needs to be displayed

      • createNewOrder

        public Order createNewOrder​(List<Taxes> allTaxes,
                            List<Product> allProducts)
        The create new order method is used of a user would like to create a new method, they would have to insert all the relevant information for that order to be created. The order date must be within the next 5 years.
        Parameters:
        allTaxes - - the taxes list that is on the system is required to reduce the chance of error when when the user is inputting tax names. Also making it easier to set all respective details required to calculate costs.
        allProducts - - the product list that is on the system is required to reduce the chance of error when the user is inputting product type. Also making it easier to set all respective details required to calculate costs
        Returns:
        - returns the newly created order.

      • continueWithOrder

        public boolean continueWithOrder()
        This method checks if the user would like to place a new order
        Returns:
        - the choice of the user (true (yes) or false (no))

      • displayNewOrderSuccessBanner

        public void displayNewOrderSuccessBanner()
        Displays message that the new order has been placed.

        public void displayOrderFailureBanner()
        Displays message that order has been cancelled.

        public LocalDate getOrderDate()
        This method is utilised to obtain a order delivery date for editing or removal
        Returns:
        - returns the order delivery date

      • getOrderNumber

        public int getOrderNumber()
        This method would get the order number from the user.
        Returns:
        - returns the inputted order number.

      • continueWithOrderCancellation

        public boolean continueWithOrderCancellation()
        This method asks the user if they would like to proceed with the order cancellation.
        Returns:
        - the choice of the user (true (yes) or false (no))

      • displayOrderCancellationFailureBanner

        public void displayOrderCancellationFailureBanner()
        Displays message that the order has not been cancelled.

      • editOrder

        public Order editOrder​(Order oldOrder,
                       List<Taxes> allTaxes,
                       List<Product> allProducts)
        If the user is to edit an orders details, this method is shown. It obtains the new input the options that can be changed else it would leave the order property as is.
        Parameters:
        oldOrder - - The order that the user would like to edit.
        allTaxes - - the taxes list that is on the system is required to reduce the chance of error when when the user is inputting tax names. Also making it easier to set all respective details required to calculate costs.
        allProducts - - the product list that is on the system is required to reduce the chance of error when the user is inputting product type. Also making it easier to set all respective details required to calculate costs
        Returns:
        - returns the edited order to the controller

      • confirmOrderChange

        public boolean confirmOrderChange()
        Ask the user if they would like to proceed in changing the order details.
        Returns:
        - the choice of the user (true (yes) or false (no))
